name: Rick Copeland
biography: Rick Copeland is a software engineer at Geeknet, the company that owns the websites SourceForge, Slashdot, ThinkGeek, FreshMeat, Ohloh, and Geek.com.  Rick is the primary author of Ming, a Python object mapper for MongoDB, and has been on two of three major initiatives at SourceForge using MongoDB.  Prior to GeekNet, Rick worked in fields from retail analytics to hardware chip design.  He holds MS in Electrical and Computer Engineering and Bachelor of Computer Engineering degrees from Georgia Tech and a Bachelor of Computer Science degree from Eckerd College.
